oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Southern Cross of Honor
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cross pattee suspended from bar. Obverse: DEO VINDICE 1861/1865, surrounded by a laurel wreath, is written at center. The four arms identify the medal as the Southern Cross of Honor. "Deo Vindice" (Latin, "with God as our champion") was the Confederate States' motto. The United Daughters of the Confederacy first presented the crosses to veterans in 1900. Reverse: Confederate battle flag inside laurel wreath. UNITED DAUGHTERS OF THE CONFEDERACY written on arms.
